message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CYBER. 

This paper focuses on modeling and selecting users on social media to improve answering performance while managing the load on people who must be asked. This involves analyzing social behavior and interactions, which falls under the categories of social media (cs.SOC), information retrieval (cs.IR), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper discusses optimization-based approaches, which could fall under cybernetics (cs.CYBER). Overall, the paper's focus on social media and information retrieval make cs.SI the most likely category, followed by cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, and cs.CYBER.
